Package it.polimi.ingsw.model

Class Model

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.observer.Observable<ViewMessage>
it.polimi.ingsw.model.Model
public class Model
extends Observable<ViewMessage>
This class merges all the game's data

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void addGod​(GodCard godCard)
    This method adds a chosen god card to the game Array This method also adds the godCard to the godsInPlay array
    GodCard assignCard​(Player player, int card)
    This method is used to assign a GodCard to a player
    void endGame()
    This function sets the game's phase to END_GAME This function is called when only one player is left It notifies the clients that the game is ended

    This method adds a player who lost to the podium at the last position, then, if only one player is left, it calls victory for that player.

    This method is called by the controller to update data for a move event
    void notifyChanges()
    This function notifies every client a new state of the board, phase, turn and message

    Similar to notifyChanges, this method is used to notify clients that there is a new phase on the game without changes to the board.

    This method is used to add a new worker for a player.

    This method resets every model's parameters to start a new game and calls the model's "initialize" function startOver is called only if every player has chosen to play again

    This method adds a player who won to the podium, then, if only one player is left, it calls the loose for the player who lost.

  • Constructor Details

    • Model

      public Model​(Player[] players, boolean simplePlay)
      Class' constructor
      Parameters:
      players - represents the actual game's players.
      simplePlay - is a boolean: if it's set to true it means that the game is played without godCard (SimpleMode mode).

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      This method configures the model and the phases of the actual game. This method also notifies every players that the game ios starting.

    • isMovedUp

      public boolean isMovedUp()
      Returns:
      true if Athena's player has moved up during his/her turn.

    • setMovedUp

      public void setMovedUp​(boolean movedUp)
      Parameters:
      movedUp - is automatically set to true by Athena when she uses her power (she goes up one level). This value remains true until the beginning of Athena's turn.

    • resetBoard

      public void resetBoard()
      This function resets the board, creating a new different Board. It's used when we want to start another game.

    • isSimplePlay

      public boolean isSimplePlay()
      Returns:
      true if the mode of the actual game is set to SimpleMode.

    • isPlayerTurn

      public boolean isPlayerTurn​(Player p)
      Parameters:
      p - is a player of the game.
      Returns:
      true if this turn is the turn of the player p.

    • setNextPhase

      public void setNextPhase​(Phase phase)
      This method sets the game's next phase.
      Parameters:
      phase - represent a phase of the game.

    • getActualPlayerId

      public int getActualPlayerId()
      Returns:
      the turn player's id (the id is used in the array turn[]).

    • getPlayers

      public Player[] getPlayers()
      Returns:
      an array of players containing every actual game's players.

    • getGodsInPlay

      public java.util.ArrayList<GodCard> getGodsInPlay()
      Returns:
      the active gods card in the game.

    • getLeftPlayers

      public int getLeftPlayers()
      Returns:
      the number of players who didn't win/loose yet.

    • getNumOfPlayers

      public int getNumOfPlayers()
      Returns:
      the number of players in the actual game.

    • setNextMessageType

      public void setNextMessageType​(MessageType messageType)
      This function sets the next phase message type that needs to be notified to the clients
      Parameters:
      messageType - is the MessageType enum instance to set

    • setNextPlayerMessage

      public void setNextPlayerMessage​(java.lang.String playerMessage)
      Parameters:
      playerMessage - is a string representing the next message that needs to be notified to the clients

    • getBoard

      public Board getBoard()
      Returns:
      the actual game's board.

    • getBoardClone

      public Board getBoardClone()
      This method returns a clone of the board.
      Returns:
      a clone of the board.

    • updateTurn

      public void updateTurn()
      This function is used to update the turn with the order in which the players join the game. If a player has won or lost he is skipped

    • getPhase

      public Phase getPhase()
      Returns:
      the actual phase of the game.

    • updatePhase

      public void updatePhase()
      This method updates the phase of the actual game.
      See Also:
      In the phase is contained the next() method.

    • setPlayerWorker

      public void setPlayerWorker​(PlayerWorker playerWorker)
      This method is used to add a new worker for a player. It gets the cell inside the board with the coordinates given to it, it then sets the cell as used. I adds a new worker for the player who ask for it (contained in the message) and at the end it notifies the clients about the changes
      Parameters:
      playerWorker - is the message received from the remote view

    • getActualPlayer

      public Player getActualPlayer()
      Returns:
      the turn player's instance.

    • addGod

      public void addGod​(GodCard godCard)
      This method adds a chosen god card to the game Array This method also adds the godCard to the godsInPlay array
      Parameters:
      godCard - is the chosen god card instance

    • getGods

      public java.util.ArrayList<GodCard> getGods()
      Returns:
      game's gods as an array

    • getPlayer

      public Player getPlayer​(int i)
      Parameters:
      i - is an int representing the value of a player in turn[].
      Returns:
      the corresponding player instance in turn[i].

    • getLeftCards

      public int getLeftCards()
      Returns:
      the number of god cards left to choose.

    • isGodAvailable

      public boolean isGodAvailable​(int card)
      Parameters:
      card - an integer representing the card's index in the array
      Returns:
      true if the selected index is available in the array

    • getGCPlayer

      public Player getGCPlayer​(Gods gods)
      This method returns the Player owning a specific GodCard (gods). This method returns null if there are no player associated to that specific card.
      Parameters:
      gods - is the GodCard involved.
      Returns:
      the player associated.

    • getNextPlayerGC

      public GodCard getNextPlayerGC()
      This method is used to get the next turn player's GodCard
      Returns:
      the GodCard instance of the next turn player

    • assignCard

      public GodCard assignCard​(Player player, int card)
      This method is used to assign a GodCard to a player
      Parameters:
      player - is the player who picked the card within the drawed ones
      card - is the drawed card's array index chosen by the player
      Returns:
      the GodCard's instance of the chosen card

    • move

      public void move​(PlayerMove move) throws java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
      This method is called by the controller to update data for a move event
      Parameters:
      move - is the message received from the controller (which received it from the client)
      Throws:
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - when you try to move outside of the board

    • increaseLevel

      public void increaseLevel​(Cell cell, Blocks level)
      This function is called by the controller to update data for a build event
      Parameters:
      cell - is the cell chosen for the built
      level - is the level that needs to be assigned to the cell
      See Also:
      Cell

    • victory

      public void victory​(Player player)
      This method adds a player who won to the podium, then, if only one player is left, it calls the loose for the player who lost. If more than one player is left, remove the player workers from the board and set the player victory flag to true At the end, ut updates the model phases and messages and notifies the changes to the clients
      Parameters:
      player - the player who won

    • loose

      public void loose​(Player player)
      This method adds a player who lost to the podium at the last position, then, if only one player is left, it calls victory for that player. If more than one player is left, it removes the player's workers from the board and sets the player lost flag to true At the end it updates the model's phases and messages and notifies the changes to the clients
      Parameters:
      player - the player who lost

    • endGame

      public void endGame()
      This function sets the game's phase to END_GAME This function is called when only one player is left It notifies the clients that the game is ended

    • startOver

      public void startOver()
      This method resets every model's parameters to start a new game and calls the model's "initialize" function startOver is called only if every player has chosen to play again

    • notifyChanges

      public void notifyChanges()
      This function notifies every client a new state of the board, phase, turn and message

    • notifyMessage

      public void notifyMessage​(java.lang.String message)
      Similar to notifyChanges, this method is used to notify clients that there is a new phase on the game without changes to the board.
      Parameters:
      message - is string representing the message that needs to be notified to clients
